SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column

Class ReferenceValue

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.fhirpath.column.ReferenceValue
public class ReferenceValue extends Object
Utility class for working with Reference columns in SQL operations.

Wraps Reference column operations and provides methods for:

  • Type extraction from reference strings and type fields
  • Validation of reference formats and type names
  • Handling both singular and array reference fields

This class centralises all Reference-related SQL column operations, similar to how QuantityValue handles Quantity operations.

Author:
John Grimes

  • Method Details

    • of

      @Nonnull public static ReferenceValue of(@Nonnull ColumnRepresentation referenceColumn, @Nonnull ColumnRepresentation typeColumn)
      Creates a ReferenceValue wrapper for the specified Reference column representations.
      Parameters:
      referenceColumn - the Reference.reference column representation
      typeColumn - the Reference.type column representation
      Returns:
      a ReferenceValue instance

    • extractTypeFromColumns

      @Nonnull public static Column extractTypeFromColumns(@Nonnull Column reference, @Nonnull Column type)
      Extracts the resource type from singular reference and type columns.

      Type extraction logic:

      1. Use type if present and valid
      2. Parse resource type from reference string
      3. Return null if neither provides a valid type

      Filtering rules:

      • Exclude contained references (starting with #)
      • Validate extracted type matches FHIR resource type pattern
      Parameters:
      reference - The Reference.reference column (may contain SQL null values)
      type - The Reference.type column (may contain SQL null values)
      Returns:
      A column containing the extracted type string, or null for unresolvable references

    • extractType

      @Nonnull public ColumnRepresentation extractType()
      Extracts the resource type from this Reference, with priority given to the explicit type field.

      Type extraction logic:

      1. Use Reference.type if present and valid
      2. Parse resource type from Reference.reference string
      3. Return null for individual references that cannot be resolved

      Handles both singular and array columns - if reference column is an array, type column is also assumed to be an array.

      Returns:
      A column representation containing the extracted type string(s)
